snippet: The legislation would subject salons in New York to some of the strictest health regulations in the country and give regulators greater authority to punish those that mistreat workers.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo will introduce two new measures to give regulators greater authority to make it easier for manicurists to acquire licenses and to punish salons that mistreat their workers; follows emergency rule changes in response to New York Times investigation finding widespread exploitation in industry.
lead_paragraph: The legislation would subject salons in New York to some of the strictest health regulations in the country and give regulators greater authority to punish those that mistreat workers.

headline.main: Cuomo to Offer New Measures to Improve Conditions in the Nail Salon Industry
headline.print_headline: Cuomo to Offer 2 Measures to Alter Nail Salon Industry
